incidents.name: Errors when Creating Teammates

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix to Teammates and confirmed the issue has been resolved for future Teammate creation and invitations. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix for Teammates and Teammate invitations affected by this incident issue and we are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
Although our engineers have identified the problem, a fix is still being explored at this time.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified why new Teammate invitations are being sent but do not allow creation of new Teammates linked to those same triggered invitations. Our team is continuing to work toward a fix to allow for proper creation of teammates and to avoid this issue from occurring. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 11:55 AM PT, our engineers began investigating an issue with Twilio SendGrid Teammate creation. Some users will experience errors in the SendGrid web user interface when creating new teammates and be unable to do so. This issue does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unable to use test feature in Legacy Campaigns

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with test feature has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified the primary cause, taken remediating action and are beginning to see recovery from this incident. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:20 AM UTC on 18th April 2024, our engineers have began investigating an issue with test feature in Legacy Campaigns. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: A Subset of Marketing Campaign Users Are Unable to Send Single Sends or Display Contacts

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Marketing Campaigns has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are still working toward a fix.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:21PM PT on April 15th, our engineers began investigating an issue where a certain subset of Marketing Campaign users are unable to create or send Single Sends. The contacts page also does not load and users can experience errors. This does impact the Contacts List API. This does not impact API mail send.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Email Delays on April 8th, 2024

incident_updates.body: Starting 5:00PM PST on Monday, April 8th, a small subset of customers saw a delay in email delivery that lasted up to 18 hours, all emails were sent successfully. Any users who saw any abnormal delay on their delivery could potentially have been affected due to this incident. There were a total of 26,300 emails affected by this incident. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Trouble Editing Scopes On New Teammates Between April 4th and April 5th, 2024

incident_updates.body: Starting 2:00PM PST on Thursday, April 4th, customers who created teammates may see errors when trying to edit those teammate scopes. Our engineers have investigated and fixed this issue for newly created teammates as of 4:30PM PST April 5th. Customers who created a teammate between Thursday and Friday are advised have to delete and recreate a new teammate to be able to edit the scopes. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with the Contact Count Not Updating after Contacts are Uploaded on New Marketing Campaigns has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers are continuing to work towards a permanent fix for this issue.  We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers are continuing to work towards a permanent fix for this issue.  We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.  Thank you for your patience.

Our engineers are working towards a short term solution to mitigate delays in contact count updates and are also investigating some long term solutions.  We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers are continuing to work towards a fix for this issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the root cause of the issue and continue testing possible fixes. At this time, customers may still notice erroneous contact counts reflected on recently updated lists. Mail Send is not affected. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are verifying the possible fixes to resolve the current issue affecting the contacts counter for Marketing customers. At this time, customers may still notice erroneous contact counts reflected on recently updated lists. Mail Send is not affected. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are investigating and continuing to work towards a fix for this issue. At this time, customers may still notice erroneous contact counts reflected on recently updated lists. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are continuing to work towards a fix for this issue. At this time, customers may still notice erroneous contact counts reflected on recently updated lists. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers began investigating a reoccurrence of the issue with contact counts not being updated with recently updated lists on new marketing campaigns. This issue is noticeable once the contacts are successfully uploaded onto a list via New Marketing campaigns.
The contacts will be available to customers for use, however customers may notice a delay of the count being updated as engineering is working towards implementing a fix.
Mail Send is not impacted.
We will provide another update in an hour, or as soon as more information becomes available

Any customers who want to upgrade to Pro, or with a Pro email API plan will not be able to make changes. incidents.name: Contact Count is Not Updated after Contacts are Uploaded on New Marketing Campaigns(TNE)

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed that Marketing Campaigns Contact count values are now reflecting as expected. Customers should see the correct contact count values reflected within their accounts, and all services are operating as epected.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Customers should see contact counts begin reflecting as expected. We'll continue to monitor and provide an update within the next hour.

Our engineers are continuing to work towards a fix for this issue. At this time, customers may still see erroneous contact counts reflected. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue causing contact uploads to not reflect in contact counts. We are working towards a fix and will provide another update within an hour or sooner if more information becomes available.

Our engineering team is still investigating the system performance of contact credit count for New Marketing Campaigns. Mail Send is not affected, and credits are being uploaded correctly. We will keep investigating and provide a new update as soon as it is available.

Starting around 15:30 hrs PDT on March 31st, our engineers began investigating an issue with contact counts not being updated with recently updated lists on new marketing campaigns(TNE). This issue is noticeable once the contacts are successfully uploaded onto a list via New Marketing campaigns. 
The contacts will be available to customers for use however customers may notice a delay of the count being updated as a workaround to update the contact count is being currently implemented. 
Mail Send is not impacted. 
We will provide another update in an hour, or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Two-Factor Authentication SMS login codes

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with two-factor authentication SMS delays has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Overall, our system has reached a normal steady state. We are continuing to monitor remaining queued messages, but as of now most messages are sending without any additional queuing delay.

We have identified the primary cause, taken remediating action and are beginning to see recovery from this incident with queued messages beginning to be sent. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting on March 26th at 5:35 AM, Pacific Time (PT). SendGrid is currently experiencing an issue with the sendgrid.com website. Customer may be unable to load the site or login to their accounts. Currently, all SMS 2FA codes are being queued preventing users from logging in with SMS 2FA. We are working on the issue, and we will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Email API and Marketing Campaigns Delivery Delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved issues with Mail Send Delays in the EU, for both Email API and Email Marketing Campaigns. From 9:30 AM to 10:00 AM PST customers may have experienced a delay when sending email. This delay only affected some mail senders in the region during the period. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Email Activity Exports Not Being Received

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Email Activity Feed Export has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are still investigating this issue. Email activity export emails might not be received by some customers. Users who are triggering an activity feed export from their SendGrid Account may not receive the subsequent email containing the export. Searching in the activity feed still functions as expected as well as the API endpoints for users with the Email Activity add-on.  We will provide the next updates in 1 hour or sooner as they become available.

Starting around 01:00 AM PT on March 18, 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with email activity export emails might not be received by some customers. Users who are triggering an activity feed export from their SendGrid Account may not receive the subsequent email containing the export. Searching in the activity feed still functions as expected as well as the API endpoints for users with the Email Activity add-on. This does not impact mail send.  We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

However, users may still had some mail delays within the timeframe specified.

incidents.name: Mail Send Drops and Inaccuracies in Stats

incident_updates.body: Starting around 11:06 AM PT on 02/26, our engineers have investigated some stats inaccuracies and resolved mail send drops. New accounts and subusers created between Thu 02/22 2:49 PM PT - Fri 02/23 4 PM PT that sent mail on Fri 02/23 between 8:15 AM - 4 PM PT would have been affected where about 16% of their emails were inadvertently dropped which would not be shown in the Stats page. The Mail Send issue has been resolved, and impacted services are operating normally.

Starting around 8:25 AM Pacific Time on Monday 02/26. We began experiencing issues with the sendgrid.com website. Customers may be unable to load Single Sends or Contacts in the UI dashboard of their accounts. In addition, mail send for Single Sends is impacted as well. Our engineering team is investigating the issue and we will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SendGrid Mail Sending Delays

incident_updates.body: After monitoring, our engineers confirmed that changes deployed to correct the identified hardware problem solved the issue and new mail traffic requested to the SendGrid system will not be delayed. This incident has been resolved.
The system is continuing to be monitored at this time as it relates to this incident.  Another update will be provided in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers confirmed that delayed emails due to this hardware problem have been successfully dequeued from the system. New mail traffic requested to the SendGrid system will not be delayed due to this problem as changes were deployed to correct the identified hardware problem. The system will continue to be monitored and another update will be provided in the next hour or as soon as possible.

Starting at 3:00 PM PT on February 6, 2024, our engineers confirmed an issue with the hardware related to mail send for the SendGrid platform. Due to this hardware issue, users of the platform may have experienced delays in mail send requests to the system. Our engineering team deployed a change to help mitigate affected delayed traffic at 3:42 PM PT. While this does affect mail send, only a subset of customers sending mail were affected.  We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

The certificate has now been updated and no expired certificates remain.

incidents.name: SendGrid Accounts Erroneously Suspended

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 6:20 AM PST on December 11th, 2023, several customer accounts were incorrectly suspended, impacting mail send. At 9:00 AM PST, these accounts were unsuspended, reactivating mail send. If your account was affected, the admin email address on file for your account will have been sent a notice of suspension and reactivation. Suspensions on these accounts did queue outbound email requests, but no mail was lost during the period. At this time, all systems are confirmed to be operational.

incidents.name: Issues displaying changes to Subuser credits

incident_updates.body: As of 12:03 PST Dec 7th the incident has been resolved and we are not seeing any new instances of this specific error. Changes made via API and UI should take effect immediately without any further delay or error. Performance has been restored.

SendGrid engineering has found the cause of the issue and deployed a fix. Users should not experience 500 errors or internal server errors in the UI. Please let us know if you continue to see any issues regarding updating subuser credits.
SendGrid engineers have identified the cause and are working restore complete functionality. We will update with more information, or again in one hour, whichever occurs first.
SendGrid Engineers are continuing to investigate this issue, and will update when we have an update or in 1 hour, whichever occurs first.

SendGrid support and engineering began to notice that subuser credit changes were not showing immediately in the UI, Despite these changes taking effect in the backend. Users may see internal service errors in the UI, or experience server 500 errors when posting via API, but the changes are being performed, and updates will show in the account after a delay. We will update with more information in roughly one hour.

incidents.name: Azure customers can present delays when processing certain account changes

incident_updates.body: Starting around 11:15 AM and until 1:23 PM PST, Azure customers may have experienced a delay in processing account changes (such as upgrades, downgrades, and unsubscribe (cancellation) requests) for their SendGrid accounts. Engineering has applied a fix for this and no delays should be expected from now on. This does not impact mail send

incidents.name: Customers unable to receive 2FA SMS codes

incident_updates.body: Our Operations team was able to locate and resolve the issue. Users should now be able to login and access app.sendgrid.com without latency or errors. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused, and thank you for your patience. If you have questions, please contact our Support team at https://support.sendgrid.com/.
Our Engineering team is currently monitoring the system performance and trying to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and implemented a fix with SMS Two Factor Authentication codes being delivered to phone numbers. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 10PM PT on 11/19/2023, our engineers began investigating an issue with logging into the SendGrid interface. Users may experience an issue after logging in with the username and password, and receive an error that states “Sorry, we were unable to send SMS at this time”. Furthermore the user is not able to login to the SendGrid Interface. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour, or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Sender Authentication Verification Failures

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed that the issue with the ability to verify new instances of Sender Authentication is operating as expected at this time.

Mitigation measures have been applied. Our third party vendor has implemented a fix and Sender Authentication Verification is working as expected. Our Engineering team is monitoring system performance now. Further update on this will be in the next 30 minutes.

The third-party service provider is still working on a solution for this. Twilio-SendGrid users may still continue to experience difficulties verifying recent instances of Sender Authentication. Our Engineering team is currently monitoring the system performance and working on the domain authentication creation backlog. We will provide an update within the next 12 hours, or as soon as we have any development on this.

The third-party service provider is still working on a solution on this. Twilio-SendGrid users may still continue to experience difficulties verifying recent instances of Sender Authentication. Our Engineering team is currently monitoring the system performance and working on the domain authentication creation backlog. We will provide an update within the next 12 hours, or as soon as we have any development on this.

The third-party service provider is continuing to work toward a fix. Users may continue to see issues with the ability to verify new instances of Sender Authentication. Our Engineering team is monitoring system performance and working towards the queue of domain creation. Further updates will be in the next 12 hours or as soon as we have more information.

Our engineering team is still monitoring system performance for all pending queues of domain creation. Furthermore, the fix applied by our third party vendor for Sender Authentication Verification is working as expected. Further updates will be in the next 12 hours or as soon as we have more information.

Starting around 8:06 AM PT, our engineers began investigating an issue with the ability to verify new instances of Sender Authentication. This is due to an issue with a third-party service and we are in contact with them to resolve the issue. This does not impact mail send or the ability to create Sender Authentication records. incidents.name: Delays in Activity Feed and Event Webhook posts for Click, Open, and Unsubscribe Events

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved the issues with Stats delays for Click, Open, and Unsubscribe Events. From 2:43 PM PST to 4:00 PM PST on Friday, 10/27/2023 customers may have experienced delays in reporting of Click, Open, and Unsubscribe events to the Activity Feed or to Event Webhooks. This did not impact mail send. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Intermittent Error When Clicking Unsubscribe Links

incident_updates.body: Our engineering team determined that unsubscribes began to intermittently fail when clicking on unsubscribe links beginning at approximately 5:10 AM PDT on October 24th, 2023. After investigating this issue further, the resulting error when links failed would include "invalid unsubscribe request" on an otherwise properly formatted unsubscribe link. Due to the nature of the issue, not all unsubscribe links during the affected period failed but instead the occurring issue intermittently affected links. On October 26th at approximately 9:30 AM PDT, the engineering team deployed code to resolve the intermittently failing unsubscribe links. Valid unsubscribe links previously failing have since been reported as resolving properly. This issue did not affect mail send. Systems are now operating normally at this time. Thank you for your patience while this issue was being resolved.

Engineers are still monitoring the issue with the Unsubscribe Links, no new reports have been received and some of these have been reported as fixed. Our team will continue to monitor this issue. We will follow up within 12 hours, or as more information is available.

Engineers are still monitoring the issue with the Unsubscribe Links, no new reports have been received and some of these have been reported as fixed. Our team will continue to monitor this issue. We will follow up within 24 hours, or as more information is available.

Engineers are still investigating the issue with the Unsubscribe Links, no new reports have been received and some of these have been reported as fixed. Our team will continue to monitor this issue. We will follow up in 1 more hour, or as more information is available.
Our engineers are continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 9:36AM PDT on October 26th, 2023, our engineers began investigating an issue with intermittent errors returned when clicking unsubscribe links in emails. This issue is affecting unsubscribe links in emails. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unable to Provision Subusers Created with V2 Subuser Management Endpoint

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have finsihed monitoring the deployed fix and confirmed the provisioning problem with the v2 sub user API has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

A fix to the v2 API sub user creation and provisioning problem has been deployed at 1:18 PM PT. At this time, new sub user accounts created specifically with the v2 API are showing to be properly provisioned after creation. As a reminder, this issue did not affect v3 sub user creation and provisioning nor did it affect mail send in any way. We will monitor the deployed fix and provide another update shortly to confirm resolution of this issue.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers are continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 10:36AM PT on October 24th, our engineers began investigating an issue where subusers are unable to complete provisioning when created with V2 API  Subuser Management Endpoint. This does not impact the v3 endpoint. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Email Billing functionality degraded

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Billing functionality has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Starting at 06:01 PDT on October 23, 2023, our engineers were alerted about an issue with SendGrid Billing updates, This issue is affecting account upgrades, request of invoices and payment functionality. This incident does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

components.name: Billing

incidents.name: Email Validations API Inaccessible Due to Unauthorized Errors

incident_updates.body: Starting at 9:55 AM PT on October 17, 2023, our engineers confirmed that API calls made to the Email Validations API endpoint began to fail with unauthorized errors. However, at 11:19 AM PT, functionality was restored to the API and services began to operate normally again. Any SendGrid users attempting to access the Email Validations API during the affected period will have experienced "403" error code responses or failure messages relating to an invalid security token. This incident did not affect mail send directly. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Login issues reported from Azure users starting on 10/10/23

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Azure customers unable to access their Twilio SendGrid accounts has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Engineers are still investigating the issue with our partners. However we are not seeing any new reports of issues for Azure customers with accessing their Twilio SendGrid account. Our team will continue to monitor this issue. We will follow up in 2 more hours, or as more information is available.

We are continuing to investigate reports of login issues starting yesterday evening. Some impacted accounts are showing the issue as resolved, please try logging in again if you were experiencing problems earlier.

Our engineering team is continuing to work with our partners to resolve this. We will provide another update in 1 hour, or as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to investigate reports of login issues starting yesterday evening, however we are seeing reduced numbers of new reports today. Our engineering team is continuing to work with our partners to resolve this. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as more information becomes available.

From around 9:47pm PST 10/10/2023, we started receiving reports about issues when users try to log into Twilio SendGrid accounts from the Azure Portal.
Affected customers when they try to click on "Open SaaS Account on publisher's site", they may see the link gray out. This is only affecting access when using SSO from Azure. Our engineering team is working with our partner to resolve this at this moment. This incident does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

components.name: Partners
components.description: Partner reseller services and integrations

incidents.name: Customers Creating Subusers that Require Provisioning

incident_updates.body:
From around 6:52am PT 10/10/2023 to about 9:56am PT 10/10/2023, we experienced an isolated issue with the creation of subusers for a certain subset of customers. 

Affected customers who tried to create a subuser account during the affected period would have seen those new accounts created in a "provision needed" status and those subuser accounts would not be functional upon creation. Affected new subusers that need provisioning will be fixed by our engineers, and should be functional shortly. 

The issue has been mitigated and resolved, and all services are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Errors When Attempting to Manage Payment Method

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved the issues with managing payment methods in the SendGrid interface. From 1:00 PM PST Oct 2nd to 1:00PM PST Oct 3rd, a very small portion of customers may have experienced errors when attempting to add or update their payment method. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Connectivity Timeouts to US East SendGrid Region

incident_updates.body: Beginning 12:00 PM PT on September 28, 2023, our engineers confirmed that connectivity began to fail for API calls made to api.sendgrid.com for a subset of users. This issue affected mail send as well as user interface web console functionality for the SendGrid platform. This only affected users which connected through the United States East Coast region to api.sendgrid.com. It was determined that one of the connectivity points within the region for api.sendgrid.com was unable to accept API traffic which was causing the API connections to fail. This connectivity point was fixed at 12:54 PM PT, and this change allowed new connections to successfully use api.sendgrid.com from the region. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Intermittent Failed Subuser Creation

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with creating subusers has been resolved. Subusers that previously failed to create have been retried by our systems and recreated. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our teams are still monitoring the fix that was implemented. Engineers are also working on retrying subusers that previously failed to create. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Users should no longer see subusers fail to create. Subusers that previously failed to create will be retried by our systems. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Users should no longer see subusers fail to create. Subusers that previously failed to create will be retried by our systems. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 7:44 AM PT, our Engineers began investigating an issue with subuser creation. At this time, customers may see subusers fail to create via the API even when receiving a 2xx level response from the API. We will provide another update on this issue within an hour or as soon as more information is available.

incidents.name: Two Factor Authentication Redirection Problems for Free Users

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Two-Factor Authentication redirection problems for Free users has been resolved. All systems are operating as expected at this time.

The issue was identified and our Engineers implemented a fix. As a way to mitigate any errors we suggest clearing cache and cookies, as this proved to be a way to avoid the infinite Two Factor Authentication redirection issue. We will provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers are completing validation steps to confirm possible solutions. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the potential cause of the infinite Two Factor Authentication redirection for "Free" accounts. Validation steps are being taken to confirm possible solutions. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting at 4:08 PM PT on September 26, 2023, our engineers began investigating a problem in which some SendGrid users are unable to properly login using Two Factor Authentication to their respective SendGrid accounts. Only a subset of customers are affected and only those with "Free" pricing packages are included in this group. When affected account users try to login, they will experience an infinite redirection loop when attempting to login using the Two Factor Authentication error. This incident does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Increased Errors to Mail Send Endpoints and Increased SMTP Timeouts

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Mail Send has been resolved. All systems are operating as expected at this time.
Our Engineers have implemented a fix and we are currently monitoring to ensure no more delay occurrences are detected.

The issue was identified and our Engineers are working on a fix right now. We are actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:00 PM PT on Thursday September 21st, 2023, our engineers began investigating an issue with Sendgrid API, affecting Mail Send requests to the v3 API, v2 API, and our SMTP servers. Customers may have experienced an increase in 5xx errors when attempting to send mail. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
